Description: Creepy, creepy stepdad.
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Engineer's Thumb
Description: In his narration, Dr. Watson notes that this is one of only two cases which he personally brought to the attention ofSherlock Holmes.

Title: The Adventure of the Noble Bachelor
Description: The disappearance of Lord Robert St. Simon's bride.
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Description: Not all is what it seems
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Copper Beeches
Description: Never trust a man who hires you but tells you to cut your hair and wear a particular outfit. That's creepy.
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: Silver Blaze
Description: Fun with horse racing
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Cardboard Box
Description: Grusome packages tied up with string
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Description: Who is that person in the window? Also, racism.

Title: The Adventure of the Musgrave Ritual
Description: Whose is it? His who is gone.
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of Reigate Squire
Description: Burglary is not what it seems
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Crooked Man
Description: Once again, the British Empire in India is a key plot point

Title: The Adventure of the Resident Patient

Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Final Problem
Description: In which Dolye tries to resolve his problem, but is untilmately unsuccesful.
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Stockbroker's Clerk
Description: A young clerk, Hall Pycroft, consults Holmes with his suspicions concerning a company that has offered him a very well-paid job.
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Empty House
Description: In which an eldery bookseller turns out to be someone else entirely.
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Norwood Builder
Description: In which no one cares about a dead hobo
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Dancing Men
Description: Cryptography!
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Solitary Cyclist
Description: Miss Violet Smith seeks Mr. Holmes' assistance when two men who knew her uncle start acting strangely.
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Priory School
Description: Prep school, jealousy, and bicycles
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of Black Peter
Description: Forest Row in the Weald is the scene of a gruesome harpoon murder, and a young police inspector, Stanley Hopkins, asks Holmes, whom he admires, for help. Holmes has already determined that it would take a great deal of strength and skill to run a man through with a harpoon and embed it in the wall behind him.
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of Charles Augustus Milverton
Description: Blackmailers are bad news
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Six Napoleons
Description: Sculpture and international espionage
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Three Students
Description: Sherlock Holmes finds himself in a famous university town (probably either Oxford or Cambridge) when a tutor and lecturer of St Luke's College, Mr. Hilton Soames, brings him an interesting problem.
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Golden Pince Nez
Description: It all comes down to a pair of glasses.
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Missing Three-Quarter
Description: Mr. Cyril Overton of Trinity College, Cambridge comes to Holmes seeking his help in Godfrey Staunton’s disappearance. Staunton is the key man on Overton’s rugby team (who plays at the three-quarters position, hence the story's title), and they will never win the important match tomorrow against Oxford if Staunton cannot be found. Holmes has to admit that sport is outside his field, but he shows the same care he has shown to his other cases.
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Abbey Grange
Description: Holmes wakes Doctor Watson up early one winter morning to rush to a murder scene at the Abbey Grange near Chislehurst. Sir Eustace Brackenstall has been killed, apparently by burglars. Inspector Stanley Hopkins believes that it was the infamous Randall gang, a father and two sons, who have committed several other burglaries in the neighborhood.
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

Title: The Adventure of the Second Stain
Description: Lord Bellinger, the Prime Minister, and Trelawney Hope, the Secretary of State for European Affairs, come to Holmes in the matter of a document stolen from Hope's dispatch box, which he kept at home in Whitehall Terrace when not at work.
Creator: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle
